q: State of the Union policy address Tuesday night. Colin Powell also lamented the lack of civility in political discourse and urged Americans to display tolerance in the wake of the shooting in Tucson, Arizona. I think he's got a way to go, Colin Powell said.`` I mean, he hasn't achieved all of his purposes, but he's stabilized the economy'' and taken on health care reform.`` You know, we didn't elect Superman.

On the official Google blog Eric Schmidt wrote that he, Page and co-founder Sergey Brin had decided it was time to make some structural changes to the company. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, wrote Eric Schmidt . He further discussed their roles, saying that Page would lead product development and technology strategy along with becoming the company's CEO. at a Feb. 3, 2003, National Security Council meeting in which Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the United Nations two days later. Rumsfeld quotes himself as telling the meeting: We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. Colin Powell objected to the plan. Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by a Sunni extremist group with ties to Abu Musab al-Zarqawi , a Jordanian who later led the

the command of George H.W. Bush 's son, President Bush . Another view on war's end The journal Foreign Policy also questions whether the war truly was successful. Memories of Desert Storm In ending the war unilaterally before Saddam Hussein had been chastened, the George H.W. Bush administration condemned the United States to a long-term presence in the Gulf in an effort to contain Iraq. This presence, and the sanctions imposed on Iraq due to Saddam Hussein 's recalcitrance, in the end served as a rallying cry for jihadists such as Osama Bin Laden against the United States and its friends in the region. Colin Powell , chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff under the first George H.W. Bush and secretary of state under the second, was among officials gathered with the elder George H.W. Bush at a symposium last week to discuss the war

has said he supports legislation proposed by fellow Republicans, Tennessee Senator Bob Corker and Indiana Representative Mike Pence , that would remove the Fed's employment mandate and have it focus solely on keeping prices stable. Ben Bernanke said inflation is expected to persist below the levels that Fed policy makers have judged to be consistent with their dual mandate from congress for stable prices and maximum employment. not want to get too comfortable with the idea of Larry Page as the t-shirt wearing, Wall Street-oblivious CEO: Page may just be an interim leader as Google looks for another Eric Schmidt , Roger Kay predicts. I think they'll realize they need an operations person in that role and hire a COO with a malleable ego who can transition to the CEO, says Roger Kay . of one sun god, Aton. The bust is at the top of a`` wish list'' of five major artefacts exhibited abroad that Egypt wants returned as part of its cultural heritage. Egypt recognises and appreciates the care and effort undertaken by the government of Germany to preserve and display the painted limestone bust of Queen Nefertiti, Zahi Hawass said in a statement. But he asked that`` this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people.'' Article: Egypt asks Berlin to return Nefertiti
